libraries.name: gnark-crypto

privacy_techniques.description: One-time use addresses that allow transaction recipients to remain anonymous
Uses separate spending key and viewing key for enhanced privacy control
components: Spending Key: Private key for controlling funds
Viewing Key: Allows selective transaction visibility (e.g., for tax purposes)

privacy_techniques.description: Efficient mechanism for recipients to quickly scan the ephemeral registry for their transactions
privacy_techniques.benefit: Nearly 5x performance improvement over DKSAP protocol

privacy_techniques.description: Type 3 pairing operations on pairing-friendly curves for anonymous address derivation
On-chain registry for sender-recipient communication without revealing identities

key_features: Recipient anonymity through unlinkable stealth addresses
Selective transaction visibility with viewing keys
Significantly improved performance over alternative protocols (5x faster than DKSAP)

repository_structure.impl: Off-chain protocol code used by sender and recipient to generate/scan data
repository_structure.stealth-api: On-chain smart contracts for sender-recipient communication

research_papers.title: Elliptic Curve Pairing Stealth Address Protocols
research_papers.description: Presents four stealth address protocols using elliptic curve pairing, including ECPDKSAP (dual-key) and ECPSKSAP (single-key) variants

funding.purpose: Research and development of pairing-based stealth address protocols

protocol_variants.name: ECPDKSAP
protocol_variants.description: Elliptic Curve Pairing Dual-Key Stealth Address Protocol

protocol_variants.name: ECPSKSAP
protocol_variants.description: Elliptic Curve Pairing Single-Key Stealth Address Protocol
features: Single key derives both spending and viewing capabilities

comparison_with_alternatives.key_difference: Uses elliptic curve pairing instead of asymmetric cryptography with Diffie-Hellman shared secret
comparison_with_alternatives.performance_advantage: ~5x faster than DKSAP protocol through gnark-crypto optimizations

limitations.quantum_vulnerability: Vulnerable to quantum attacks (addressed in follow-up research with post-quantum variants)
limitations.computational_cost: Pairing operations are expensive, though optimized through gnark-crypto
